#summary The SVG <circle> element represents a circle.
You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *circle element*

= Introduction =

The circle element is used to draw a circle.

= Details =
== Usage ==

{{{
<circle cx="100" cy="100" r="50" fill="green" />
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#CircleElementCXAttribute cx] - the x-coordinate of the center of the circle
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#CircleElementCYAttribute cy] - the y-coordinate of the center of the circle
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#CircleElementRAttribute r] - the radius of the circle
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#FillProperty fill] - describes how the interior of the circle should be painted, see [SVGFillProperties].  The default value is "black".
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#StrokeProperty stroke] - describes how the outline of the circle should be painted, see [SVGStrokeProperties]. The default value is "none".
